unicode.value: Smart shopping
Isabel Díaz Gutiérrez, Mercedes Fernández Ramírez, Carmen Morales Gómez, María Jesús Díaz Aguilar, Susana López Gómez, Lucía Fernández Paredes, María Rosario Reyes Márquez

En este recurso, dirigido al alumnado de 3º y 4º de la ESO, se abordan las diferencias entre comercios de proximidad, grandes superficies y compras online, vocabulario relacionado con tiendas, compras, consumo, y se propone aprender a elaborar una campaña de publicidad en defensa del pequeño comercio.
master class
closed exercise or problem
real project
didactic game
open problem
conceptual map
guided reading
Sección
Smart shopping
5. Become a publicist
5.1. Local businesses
Info about the stores

string.value: CSS class

unicode.value:
Remember that to create a good campaign, you need a good slogan and advertising techniques to appeal to your target. 

Quick Store Recap

Are you ready to do a quick and general review of the stores visited using the information collected?

Each group has 2 minutes to present a brief summary of one of the stores they visited, using their Store Info Sheetas a guide (https://classroom.google.com/w/NzA5Nzk0OTM1NDcx/tc/NzM1MjcyOTU0ODE0)

                         

Recuerda que para crear una buena campaña, necesitas un buen eslogan y técnicas publicitarias que atraigan a tu público objetivo.

Resumen rápido de las tiendas

¿Estáis listos para hacer un repaso rápido y general de las tiendas visitadas usando la información recopilada?

Cada grupo tiene 2 minutos para presentar un breve resumen de una de las tiendas que se visitaron, utilizando vuestra Store Info Sheet como guía.

Written Comprehension

Reading

1. Read the title of the text and answer the question.

Part A: Why do you think it is important to support local stores instead of shopping at large chain stores?

Practice with these slogans and their translations in the following exercise.

Exercise1 Part A:

Supporting local shops helps our community in many ways. It keeps money in our town, protects local jobs, and reduces pollution because products travel less. Plus, small stores offer unique things and help our neighborhood stay special.

Translation

Match the slogans to their translations

unicode.value:
Practice using comparative (-er/-r/-ier than/ more ...than) and superlative adjectives (less...than/The ...-est/-st/-iest) by comparing popular advertising slogans and the products sold by the companies behind these slogans.

Read the sentences below and fill in the gaps with the comparative or superlative forms of the adjectives given. Use a comparative or superlative adjective of inferiority (less...than/the least) in the even-numbered sentences.
University of Auckland
If this option is checked, submitted answers with different capitalization will be marked as incorrect.

1. Nike´s slogan is more motivating than (motivating) McDonald´s slogan.

2. Apple's slogan is the least innovative (innovative) of all.

3. Mc Donald´s slogan "I´m loving it" is catchier than (catchy) other slogans.

4. L'Oréal's slogan is the least empowering (empowering) of all.

5. Tesco's slogan is more helpful than (helpful)  the American Express slogan.

6. Capital One´s slogan 'What´s in your wallet?' is less inspiring than (inspiring) Adidas´slogan 'Imposible is nothing'.

7. "Mastercard's slogan 'There are some things money can't buy' is the most trustworthy (trustworthy) in the financial sector.

8. Walmart's slogan 'Save money. Live better' is less memorable than (memorable) LÓréal´s slogan 'Because you´re worth it'.

9. Red Bull's slogan 'It gives you wings' is more creative than (creative) KitKat's slogan 'Have a break, have a KitKat'.

10. Disneyland's slogan 'The happiest place on Earth' is the least engaging  (engaging) among theme parks.

11. McDonald´s food is cheaper than (cheap) Planet Hollywood´s, but Planet Hollywood´s food is  better (good).

12. Lamborghini is one of  the least affordable (affordable) brand in the car market.

13. Ferrari is more powerful than (powerful) Mazda.

14. Dacia is  less luxurious than  (luxurious) BMW.

15. Telepizza is easier than (easy) Domino´s for online ordering.

16. Among sports cars, Smart is  the least powerful (powerful).

17. Burger King is the biggest   (big) burger chain after McDonald's.

18. Five Guys is less cheap than (cheap) Taco Bell

19. Revlon is worse than (bad) Lancôme.

20. Among family restaurants, Applebee's is the least popular (popular)
If this option is set, each word will be marked as the learner types it rather than all the words being marked the end of the exercise.

Enter the text for the cloze activity in to the cloze field by either pasting text from another source or by typing text directly into the field.

To select words to hide, double click on the word to select it and click on the Hide/Show Word button below.

More than one possible answer can be defined enclosing them with pipes (|). I.e.: |dog|cat|bird|

If left unchecked a small number of spelling and capitalization errors will be accepted. If checked only an exact match in spelling and capitalization will be accepted.

For example: If the correct answer is Elephant then both elephant and Eliphant will be judged "close enough" by the algorithm as it only has one letter wrong, even if "Check Capitalization" is on.

If capitalization checking is off in the above example, the lowercase e will not be considered a mistake and eliphant will also be accepted.

If both "Strict Marking" and "Check Capitalization" are set, the only correct answer is "Elephant". If only "Strict Marking" is checked and "Check Capitalization" is not, "elephant" will also be accepted.

Cloze exercises are texts or sentences where students must fill in missing words. They are often used for the following purposes:

  1. To check knowledge of core course concepts (this could be a pre-check, formative exercise, or summative check).
  2. To check reading comprehension.
  3. To check vocabulary knowledge.
  4. To check word formation and/or grammatical competence.

If your goal is to test understanding of core concepts or reading comprehension

Write a summary of the concept or reading long enough to adequately test the target's knowledge, but short enough not to induce fatigue. Less than one typed page is probably adequate, but probably considerably less for young students or beginners.

Select words in the text thatare key to understanding the concepts. Thesewill probably be verbs, nouns, and key adverbs.Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test vocabulary knowledge

Write a text using the target vocabulary. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Highlight the target words in the text. Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test word formation/grammar:

Write a text using the target forms. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Remember that the goal is not vocabulary knowledge, so the core meanings of the stem words should be well known to the students.

Highlight the target words in the text. Provide alternatives with the same word stem, but different affixes. It is a good idea to get a colleague to test the test/exercise to make sure there are no surprises!
Cloze Activity
Enter any feedback you wish to provide the learner with-in the feedback field. This field can be left blank.

Comparative Adjectives (superiority):

- Form: adjective + -er/-r/-ier (for short adjectives) than or more + adjective (for long adjectives) than 

Superlative Adjectives:

- We use superlative adjectives to compare one thing with all others.

- Form: the + adjective + -est/-st/-iest (for short adjectives) or the most + adjective (for long adjectives)

Comparatives and Superlatives (Inferiority):

Interesting (Interesante):

Comparative: Less interesting than (Menos interesante que)
Superlative: The least interesting (El menos interesante)


Expensive (Caro):

Comparative: Less expensive than (Menos caro que)
Superlative: The least expensive (El menos caro)


Important (Importante):

Comparative: Less important than (Menos importante que)
Superlative: The least important (El menos importante)

Irregular adjectives

These adjectives do not follow the general rule of adding -er /-r /-ier  for the comparative and -est/-st/-iest for the superlative but have irregular forms instead.

True-False Question
Provide instruction on how the True/False Question should be completed.
Complete the quiz based on the video with true or false answers.
University of Auckland
Enter any feedback you wish to provide to the learner. This field may be left blank. if this field is left blank default feedback will be provided.
A hint may be provided to assist the learner in answering the question.

True/false questions present a statement where the learner must decide if the statement is true. This type of question works well for factual information and information that lends itself to either/or responses.
Type the question stem. The question should be clear and unambiguous. Avoid negative premises as these can tend to be ambiguous.
True-False Question
Escriba la pregunta. La pregunta debe ser clara y no ambigua. Evite las premisas negativas ya que esta tienden a ser ambiguas.

Homework

As homework, each group will develop creative ideas to present in class the following day. These ideas will be worked on as a team to create the slogan.

Practise with the comparative and superlative adjectives.

Click on:

https://www.liveworksheets.com/es/c?a=c&sr=n&l=sb&i=ocdsnc&r=ch&f=dzdczcdo&ms=uz&cd=klpfjknplkkwngnkgknjxg&mw=hs

In the Resources section, you can find tutorial videos that will be very useful, as you will need them to create your slogans for tomorrow's class. Otherwise, you will use Google Slides, as you have on previous occasions.

string.value: CSS class

unicode.value: Text and Tasks
5.2. Actividad desarrollo competencia digital
Creating the slogan

string.value: CSS class

unicode.value:
Introduction

Activity: Creating the Slogan (Structuring)

In groups of 4 or 5, a slogan will be created. Once it's made, it will be presented in a video using digital tools. This video will be uploaded to YouTube, and finally, the link to this video will be uploaded to Classroom.

Objective: Apply prior research, vocabulary, and grammar skills to design a compelling slogan collaboratively.

Preparation and Recap (5 minutes):

Review the ideas developed as homework. Each group member briefly shares their creative concepts and insights from the previous day.
Highlight key elements of effective slogans based on the video, the translated examples, and any vocabulary or grammar practiced in earlier sessions.

Team Collaboration (15 minutes):

In groups of four/five, students work together to refine the ideas shared during the recap.
They brainstorm and evaluate their ideas to create a slogan that is memorable, persuasive, and relevant to their product or concept.

Final Touches and Presentation (5 minutes):

Each group finalises their slogan, ensuring it is concise, impactful, and grammatically correct.

If time allows, groups can present their slogans briefly to the class, explaining the reasoning and creativity behind their choices. (2 minutes per group)

What and how to do it

Steps to Create and Upload the Presentation to YouTube

Preparation of Content

Divide responsibilities within the group:

Slogan Design Team: Finish the slogan and prepare its explanation (why it works, target audience, creativity).
Visual Team: Create visuals or slides (using Google Slides or Canva) that showcase the slogan with images, design elements, and supporting text.
Narration Team: Write a script to explain the process and reasoning behind the slogan.



Creating the Presentation
Use a presentation tool (Canva or Google Slides) to design the slides.

Include:
Title Slide: Group name, project title, and the slogan.
Process Slides: Steps taken to create the slogan (research, brainstorming, refinement).
Final Slogan Slide: Display the slogan prominently with visuals or mockups (e.g., on a product, banner, or advertisement).
Closing Slide: Thank the viewers and include the group members' names.

Recording the Presentation
Use screen recording software like OBS Studio.

Assign a group member (or multiple members) to narrate the slides based on the prepared script.
Ensure clear audio and smooth transitions between slides.

             

Editing the Video



Edit the recorded video using free tools like CapCut or Clipchamp.
Add background music (if desired) and ensure visuals are synchronized with the narration.
Keep the video concise (3–5 minutes recommended).

Uploading to YouTube and Sharing the Video



One group member should create or log in to a YouTube account.
Go to the YouTube homepage and click the "Create" button (camera icon with a plus sign).

Select "Upload Video" and follow these steps:
Add a Title (e.g., Creative Slogan Project - Group 4).
Write a Description explaining the task and what the video showcases.
Add relevant tags (e.g., slogan creation, student project, advertising).
Select an appropriate thumbnail (you can upload one or let YouTube generate one).
Set the visibility to private.

Copy the YouTube video link after publishing and share it with me in Google Clasroom

Pro Tips:

Rehearse the presentation to ensure smooth delivery.
Use engaging visuals and clear fonts to make the video appealing.
Test audio and video quality before uploading.



Translation (Introduction)

Actividad: Crear el Eslogan (Estructuración)

En grupos de 4 ó 5, se va a crear un eslogan. Una vez creado, se presentará en video usando herramientas digitales. Este video se subirá a Youtube y, finalmente, se subirá el enlace de este video al Classroom.

Objetivo: Aplicar investigaciones previas, vocabulario y habilidades gramaticales para diseñar de manera colaborativa un eslogan atractivo.

Preparación y Repaso (5 minutos):

·         Revisen las ideas desarrolladas como tarea. Cada integrante del grupo comparte brevemente sus conceptos creativos e ideas del día anterior.

Resalten los elementos clave de los eslóganes efectivos basándose en el video, los ejemplos traducidos y el vocabulario o gramática practicados en sesiones anteriores.
Colaboración en Equipo (15 minutos):

En grupos de cuatro/cinco, los estudiantes trabajan juntos para refinar las ideas compartidas durante el repaso.
Realizan una lluvia de ideas y evalúan las propuestas para crear un eslogan que sea memorable, persuasivo y relevante para su producto o concepto.

Toques Finales y Presentación (5 minutos):

Cada grupo finaliza su eslogan, asegurándose de que sea conciso, impactante y gramaticalmente correcto.
Si hay tiempo, los grupos pueden presentar brevemente sus eslóganes a la clase, explicando el razonamiento y la creatividad detrás de sus elecciones.

Translation (What and how to do it)

Qué y cómo debo hacerlo?

Pasos para Crear y Subir la Presentación a YouTube

Preparación del Contenido

Dividid responsabilidades dentro del grupo

Equipo de Diseño del Eslogan: Finalizar el eslogan y preparar su explicación (por qué funciona, público objetivo, creatividad).
Equipo Visual: Crear imágenes o diapositivas (usando Google Slides o Canva) que presenten el eslogan con diseños, elementos visuales y texto de apoyo.
Equipo de Narración: Escribir un guion para explicar el proceso y la lógica detrás del eslogan.

Creación de la Presentación

Utilizad una herramienta de presentaciones (Canva o Google Slides) para diseñar las diapositivas.

Incluid:

Diapositiva de Título: Nombre del grupo, título del proyecto y el eslogan.
Diapositivas del Proceso: Pasos realizados para crear el eslogan (investigación, lluvia de ideas, refinamiento).
Diapositiva del Eslogan Final: Mostrar el eslogan de manera destacada con elementos visuales o ejemplos (como en un producto, banner o anuncio).
Diapositiva Final: Agradecimientos y nombres de los integrantes del grupo.

Grabación de la Presentación
·         Utilizad un programa para grabar la pantalla como OBS Studio.

·         Asignad a un miembro (o varios) del grupo para narrar las diapositivas usando el guion preparado.

·         Aseguraros de tener audio claro y transiciones suaves entre diapositivas.

Edición del Video (si fuera necesario)
·         Editad con herramientas gratuitas como CapCut o Clipchamp.

·         Agregad música de fondo (opcional) y aseguraros de sincronizar los visuales con la narración.

·         Mantened el video conciso (recomendado entre 2-3 minutos).

Subida del Video a YouTube y Compartir el Video

·         Un integrante del grupo debe crear o iniciar sesión en una cuenta de YouTube.

·         Tenéis que ir a la página principal de YouTube y hacer clic en el botón "Crear" (icono de cámara con un signo de más).

·         Seleccionad "Subir Video" y seguid estos pasos:

Añadid un Título (por ejemplo, Proyecto de Eslogan Creativo - Grupo 4).

Escribid una descripción explicando la tarea y lo que muestra el video.

Añadid etiquetas relevantes (como creación de eslóganes, proyecto estudiantil, publicidad).

Seleccionad una miniatura adecuada (pueden subir una o usar una generada por YouTube).

Estableced la visibilidad como privada.(Cómo crear y subir el video).

Copiad el enlace del video de YouTube después de publicarlo y compartidlo conmigo.

Consejos Prácticos:

Ensayad la presentación para asegurar una entrega fluida.
Utilizad visuales atractivas y fuentes claras para que el video sea más interesante.
Proba la calidad del audio y video antes de subirlo.
Text and Tasks
Resources (How to ...)

unicode.value:
In the Resources section, you can find tutorial videos that will be very useful, as you will need them to create your slogans for tomorrow's class. The school computers have Canva and OBS Studio installed. If you don’t have a Canva account yet, you can easily create one if you want to use Canva for your presentation. Otherwise, you will use Google Slides, as you have on previous occasions.

How to create a presentation on Google Slides


How to create a presentation on Canva

How to upload videos on YouTube

How to use OBS Studio
Text and Tasks
Autoría

string.value: CSS class

unicode.value:
Título: Smart shopping

Descripción

En este recurso, dirigido al alumnado de 3º y 4º de la ESO, se abordan las diferencias entre comercios de proximidad, grandes superficies y compras online, vocabulario relacionado con tiendas, compras, consumo, y se propone aprender a elaborar una campaña de publicidad en defensa del pequeño comercio.


Persona elaboradora de contenido

Isabel Díaz Gutiérrez
Persona elaboradora de contenido
Mercedes Fernández Ramírez
Persona elaboradora de contenido
Carmen Morales Gómez

Persona coordinadora de ciclo
Lucía Fernández Paredes
Persona coordinadora de materia
Rosario Reyes Márquez

Organización

Dirección General de Formación del Profesorado e Innovación Educativa. Consejería de Educación y Deporte. Junta de Andalucía.

Isabel Díaz Gutiérrez, Mercedes Fernández Ramírez, Carmen Morales Gómez, María Jesús Díaz Aguilar, Susana López Gómez, Lucía Fernández Paredes, María Rosario Reyes Márquez

En este recurso, dirigido al alumnado de 3º y 4º de la ESO, se abordan las diferencias entre comercios de proximidad, grandes superficies y compras online, vocabulario relacionado con tiendas, compras, consumo, y se propone aprender a elaborar una campaña de publicidad en defensa del pequeño comercio.
Web Site
Consejería de Educación y Deporte de la Junta de Andalucía.
Licencia Creative Commons
Proyecto REA
Smart shopping
creative commons: attribution - non commercial - share alike 4.0

string.value: narrative text

Los objetivos que se fija este REA son dos: poder hablar y solicitar informaci\xc3\xb3n sobre nuestras actividades cotidianas, nuestras preferencias y aficiones, y ser capaces de compartir en medios digitales y redes sociales esta informaci\xc3\xb3n de una forma segura cuando compartimos v\xc3\xaddeos. Para esto, se aprender\xc3\xa1n conceptos audiovisuales b\xc3\xa1sicos, as\xc3\xad como consejos de seguridad en la red, de modo que se pueda controlar lo que se comparte y con qui\xc3\xa9n se comparte. \nPara culminar con \xc3\xa9xito este REA, el alumnado tendr\xc3\xa1 que elaborar su propia v\xc3\xaddeo-presentaci\xc3\xb3n para compartir en redes sociales o canales del centro, teniendo en cuenta un dec\xc3\xa1logo de seguridad a la hora de compartir contenidos personales en internet o redes sociales. A trav\xc3\xa9s de las distintas p\xc3\xa1ginas y actividades, los alumnos tendr\xc3\xa1n que reflexionar sobre su d\xc3\xada a d\xc3\xada, seleccionar la informaci\xc3\xb3n que quieren compartir y realizar pr\xc3\xa1cticas de v\xc3\xaddeo grabaci\xc3\xb3n hasta llegar a la tarea final.

En este recurso, dirigido al alumnado de 3\xc2\xba y 4\xc2\xba de la ESO, se abordan las diferencias entre comercios de proximidad, grandes superficies y compras online, vocabulario relacionado con tiendas, compras, consumo, y se propone aprender a elaborar una campa\xc3\xb1a de publicidad en defensa del peque\xc3\xb1o comercio.
